pages.text: I am affected by the outside temperature which is different depending on the biome and dimension I am in. It raises or lowers my body temperature until reaching a dangerous level at which I start to die.
I can raise and lower my body temperature by drinking chilled or heated waterskins. This does not stop the outside from affecting my body temperature.

I can protect myself further by stabilizing the external temperature. I can do this by positioning and fueling a hearth in my base, or placing multiple, one every 30 or so blocks, to cover a larger area.
I can use a sewing table to insulate my armor, protecting my from extreme temperatures when I leave my base.
I can use a soulspring lamp to cool down a small area around me while in the nether, protecting me from the deadly heat. The lamp is fueled by warped or crimson stems.
